title: How to Make Fish Pie

steps.headline: Cut raw boneless, skinless salmon into bite-size chunks.
steps.description: Then cut raw undyed smoked haddock fillets with the bones and skin removed into bite-size pieces.

steps.headline: Substitute cod in place of the salmon, if you prefer.
Use any white fish, such as cod, alone in the recipe for a more uniform fish flavor.
Add the fish pieces into the 9x13 inch baking dish.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can poach the fish first for 5 to 8 minutes in water and milk and then flake it before adding it to the baking dish.

steps.headline: Mix in raw king prawns, if desired.
Choose as many or as few of these vegetables and additions you want for your homemade fish pie.
steps.description: There are many combinations you can try. Grate a carrot, a couple stalks of celery and cheddar cheese with the course side of the grater. Substitute sweet peas in the place of celery, if desired. Grate the zest of a lemon and 1/2 of a fresh red chili using the fine side of the grater. Chop sprigs of fresh parsley. Gently fry chopped leeks and sliced mushrooms in olive oil.

steps.headline: Add your choice of seasonings.
steps.description: Add salt and pepper to taste. You can squeeze lemon juice over the ingredients in the baking dish and add a drizzle of olive oil.

steps.headline: Make an optional creamy sauce for your fish pie.
steps.description: Sauté a shallot. Add a couple tbsp. of white wine vinegar and boil until it evaporates. Stir 1 to 2 oz. of flour. Slowly add in 15 oz. of fish stock and stir it constantly as it cooks over medium heat. Bring it to a boil until it thickens then remove from heat. Add 6 tbsp. double cream and a tsp. or 2 of chopped chives or dill. Add salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Stir all the ingredients in the baking dish together with a large spoon until well mixed.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Top with mashed potatoes, if preferred.
Slice potatoes and layer on top of the ingredients, as an alternative to mashed potatoes.
steps.description: Or you can use grated potatoes with cheese sprinkled on top or grated sweet potatoes as a topping.

steps.headline: Use puff pastry or shortcrust for a sweeter fish pie topping.
Place the baking dish into the preheated oven and cook for approximately 40 minutes or until the top is evenly browned.

text: Choosing and Preparing Fish Cut raw boneless, skinless salmon into bite-size chunks. Then cut raw undyed smoked haddock fillets with the bones and skin removed into bite-size pieces. Substitute cod in place of the salmon, if you prefer.  Use any white fish, such as cod, alone in the recipe for a more uniform fish flavor.  Add the fish pieces into the 9x13 inch baking dish. Alternatively, you can poach the fish first for 5 to 8 minutes in water and milk and then flake it before adding it to the baking dish. Mix in raw king prawns, if desired.  Mixing in the Additions Choose as many or as few of these vegetables and additions you want for your homemade fish pie. There are many combinations you can try. Grate a carrot, a couple stalks of celery and cheddar cheese with the course side of the grater. Substitute sweet peas in the place of celery, if desired. Grate the zest of a lemon and 1/2 of a fresh red chili using the fine side of the grater. Chop sprigs of fresh parsley. Gently fry chopped leeks and sliced mushrooms in olive oil. Add your choice of seasonings. Add salt and pepper to taste. You can squeeze lemon juice over the ingredients in the baking dish and add a drizzle of olive oil. Make an optional creamy sauce for your fish pie. Sauté a shallot. Add a couple tbsp. of white wine vinegar and boil until it evaporates. Stir 1 to 2 oz. of flour. Slowly add in 15 oz. of fish stock and stir it constantly as it cooks over medium heat. Bring it to a boil until it thickens then remove from heat. Add 6 tbsp. double cream and a tsp. or 2 of chopped chives or dill. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir all the ingredients in the baking dish together with a large spoon until well mixed.  Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).  Making the Topping Top with mashed potatoes, if preferred.  Slice potatoes and layer on top of the ingredients, as an alternative to mashed potatoes. Or you can use grated potatoes with cheese sprinkled on top or grated sweet potatoes as a topping. Use puff pastry or shortcrust for a sweeter fish pie topping.  Place the baking dish into the preheated oven and cook for approximately 40 minutes or until the top is evenly browned. Serve hot.
